definition: to be worth reading a hundred times (idiom)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: You never get tired of reading this book.
Which eyes not yet created shall o'er-read;
sentences.chinese: 百讀不厭的將是未來的眼睛。

sentences.english: I never tire of reading classics.
sentences.chinese: 這些古典名著我百讀不厭。

sentences.english: I never get tired of reading this book.
I read and reread his short stories and plays.
sentences.chinese: 他的短篇小說和劇作我百讀不厭。

sentences.english: These are my all-time favorite reads.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是我百讀不厭的好書。
